meanings.definition: To take back or regain possession of something.
meanings.sent1: After losing his wallet, he had to reassuming it from the lost and found.
meanings.sent2: She reassuming her favorite book from the library after returning it.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept reassuming the toy mouse from the dog's mouth.
meanings.sent4: The sun reassuming its place in the sky after a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The child reassuming his toy truck from his friend's hands.

meanings.definition: To take on or resume a particular role or position.
meanings.sent1: She reassuming her role as the team captain after being injured.
meanings.sent2: The actor reassuming his character on stage after a quick costume change.
meanings.sent3: The dog reassuming its position as the guard of the house.
meanings.sent4: The sun reassuming its role as the center of the solar system.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reassuming her position at the front of the classroom.

meanings.definition: To assert or take back a previous statement or belief.
meanings.sent1: He reassuming his claim that he saw a UFO last night.
meanings.sent2: She reassuming her opinion on the best movie of all time.
meanings.sent3: The politician kept reassuming his promise to lower taxes.
meanings.sent4: The scientist reassuming his theory after new evidence emerged.
meanings.sent5: The student reassuming his answer after realizing he made a mistake.
